Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: bohemiancommune
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is terrible, and 3/4 the problem is the management. The manager, Mr. Zahed Hussien and the night manager especially, Nasia Uwulh, make this the worst possible location to come and rest your head. Don't let the low price pull you in. You will not even get what you pay for! Having the night to kill, I wandered down to the nightclub on the premise... only to be told that I am not welcome as it is Indians only... Indians only? And this went all the way up to the OWNER... Raj, arrogant and prejudiced... not in the way you'd think you would run into! I was baffled and tried to take this up to the management, only to be told, and I quote (only because I promised I would) Night Manager, Nasia Uwulh: "We don't have time to here you're complaint, and if you want to continue, we will call the authorities and tell them you have been harassing us" and this is AS A GEUST OF THE HOTEL!!!!! I was baffled to say the least. The evening security manager was an honest man and tried to do what he could, but in the end, he could not override the club owner, Raj and the night manager Nasia Uwulh. When all was said and done, I grabbed my things right then and there, and walked to the nearest hotel, absolutely refusing to spend the rest of the night there. After writing this, my next act of recourse is to contact dubai.tourism.ae or 80070090. I have NEVER seen this type of racism... I feel awkward crying 'racism' outside of the typical situation, but the entire hotel management got behind it... final word: DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loud music at night”
Reviews.Author: milosrb79
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location. It is just next to the Metro Station-Salah Al Din. Once you are in metro you can get anywhere. Also, Union is very close about 1.5 kilometres far and the street that connects Union and the next Metro station-Al Rigga is very close to the hotel and it is worth visiting because there are many shops, restaurants, fast food restaurants,etc. They are all on walking distance from the hotel. You can also walk to the Creek from the Hotel. Close to the hotel, in the same street is a souvenir, gift, perfume shop which is called Gift Village Discount Center,just opposite from Reef Mall. The bad part of the Royal Falcon hotel is the disco club, actually two disco clubs which are situated on the first floor.I was on the third floor and I could barely sleep.The music finished at 2 or 3 am. Then, in the lobby there are many prostitutes at night and one can pick up any of them. The room was ok. Only I had a problem with the door lock.If I turned the key once, it was still unlocked. I had to turn the key twice to lock the door which was ok for me, but the cleaning lady kept turning the key once and on two occasions I came to the room to find out that it was unlocked. So I had to write a message to my cleaning lady to turn the keys twice. Before my departure from the hotel I noticed that the problem was fixed. All in all, I wouldn`t recommend this hotel to the families with children, but to solo travelers it was worth visiting especially talking about the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Unorthodox, Different, Sexy & Cool”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in October 2011 for ten days and was pleased with my stay. The staff was friendly, my room was kept clean, and my stay was so cheap I was able to spend more money on shopping and excursions. The metro station is less than a block away and took me everywhere I wanted to go......even the Dubai Marina!! The morning prayer in the loud speakers outside does not wake you up at 5:30am like some other hotels ( I say this with no disrespect to Muslim religion) This is not the type of hotel you stay at if you are very conservative or on a family vacation. Cheap fathers, do not bring your family here lol. You will like the Hotel if you are traveling by yourself, with your buddy, or with a girlfriend who is not conservative and likes to have fun and party. There are at least 4 clubs in the Hotel and sometimes music can be heard in your room until at 2am. Even though you could hear it, I don't think it was too loud. The music actually helped me sleep since I was by myself. The DJ's tracks were also good too lol ( I stayed for 10 days) The Hotel and area is extremely safe and you have nothing to worry about. But then again, I am very respectful and do not discriminate against anybody. One thing I did not like was I paid $24 (AED 84) a day for internet. The only option was per hour or 24 hours. It was over $10 to have it for one hour so had to accept 24hr internet since I needed it for at least a few hours within a 24hr period. If I could pause my time then $24 would have been worth it but you didn't have that option. If the Wi-fi was cheaper I would have given this hotel a better rating. The Royal Falcon is a great place to stay if you are just looking for a cheap place to sleep while you explore Dubai. Overall, I had a great stay and will come back if the internet is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and awfully publicized”
Reviews.Author: hab154
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this hotel and had to flee to another hotel as early as 6.0 am because the hotel was so smelly and noisy. This is a place where there are 8 floors with three first floors with cabarets and discos. Very noisy and we could not sleep at all (i was accompanied by my wife and 2 daughters). The rooms were small not exceeding 9 m² each against the published 40 m² on booking.com. I really believe that Dubai Authorities should close down such establishments. They are worse than some filthy hotels of the far east. It does not even deserve the 0/10 mark.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: Travellingesther
Reviews.Content: Positve: convenient location towards the airport Negative: Free extras as agreed on HRS booking were withheld Passport was taken and refused to hand out for carrying it while being in the city Credit Card reader did not work (for payment) Smoke alarm destroyed, from the looks of it years ago. Telefone: Did not work Cleanliness left to be desired Service vastly unfriendly AC: cooled down to 16 °C with no option to controle from within the room. When I called reception from my german mobile, the staff either could not or wanted not to understand me. I would have coped with all of that for one night. But when BEDBUGS were running across the second cushion on my bed ... I fled this place at four o'clock in the morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - near the airport, walking distance to reef mall and metro station”
Reviews.Author: annsherry
Reviews.Content: There are I think 5 types of pub / night clubs in this hotel, and its up to you if you will go inside the pubs. We ignored the people around, we went straight to our room since we're tired from going around the whole day. Don't walk-in and check-in. If you can, book it in advance. Its way cheaper! I booked 3 nights only instead of 4nights 3 days cos we arrive 2am. I thought i can get discount or get it free if we will do early check in, it was unsuccessful. I paid 300dirham for 1 night whilst 447dirhams for the 3 nights!!!! I get over it, i need my sleep. its convenient cos its walking distance the reef mall and the metro station. there's a 24hr grocery story across the road. Also, its near the airport. Unless I can afford to stay in a 5-star hotel, i will not complain staying here cos its way cheaper anyway. So for those who are complaining about the pubs, then try checking in to those expensive hotels. it is right to manage our expectation base on the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel in the city?”
Reviews.Author: SophieG115
Reviews.Content: Needing a hotel for just a few hours before my friend's 3am trip to the airport, I assumed that the Royal Falcon Hotel would provide a clean, albeit very basic, room to suit this purpose. How wrong I was. On arrival we were greeted by a lovely porter (definitely the only pleasant experience we had). We checked in and were told the lifts were broken, and so we were able to move to a room on the 2nd floor rather than the 7th. After an unpleasant climb up the stairs (which housed sleeping people, shared bathrooms and roaches) we reached the room which was next to the questionable 'massage centre'. The room was dirty, the ceiling was stained, and the bathroom was simply disgusting. Fearing for our lives (quite honestly), we immediately went to the reception to leave. We were, very impressively, given a full refund - clearly this was not the first time someone has checked out virtually on arrival. Please, I advise anyone needing a cheap hotel in Dubai, spend that little extra and stay somewhere you can feel safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “OMG nothing but a brothel !”
Reviews.Author: woodykay21
Reviews.Content: well to start off with it i immediatly seen the flock of women on entering the hotel as we arrived at night well me being as niave as i am me, my partner and my 15yr old sister went to the nightclub in the hotel only to be leered at which is annoying and makes u feel like the men are undressing u with there eyes well we had 1 drink each then about 5 belly dancers was dancing in the room and all the men was sticking money on them for private dance's i demanded my bill for the drinks and he wanted to charge me £85 pound for three drinks all because we got a glimpse of the girls dancing i didnt pay the 85 pound and paid 25 pound instead i felt threatened by the manager of the club who was also a sleeze the hotel stunk prossies everywhere AVOID AVOID i am not snob or aything this was once in a lifetime trip that was ruined all by this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I'm still in shock.......this is the worse hotel I have ever seen and stayed in - AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: lifes4living31
Reviews.Content: I always check the trip advisor reviews before booking hotels but I rquired a hotel fairly close to Dubai airport as I had an early flight to catch the next day and on this occasion I didnt read the comments, what a massive mistake to make. This is my 3rd stay in Dubai and i've previously stayed in 5 star hotels. This hotel is rated either a 2 or 3 star hotel and that is being generous, I wouldnt give it a star at all. I didnt dream there could be such a massive difference. All I wanted was a clean bed for the night. I arrived at the hotel to be told the lifts were out of order as there had been a fire....this worried me. My first impressions of the reception were not good but there was no one else there and I was taken to my room on the 2nd floor. I immediately saw the 'massage' sign and once in my pit of a room there was a plaque advertising massages from 11am to 3am, utter sleeze. My room was disgusting, the curtains wouldnt open and were hanging off the rails. I couldnt see out my window as there was condensation within the glass. The TV didnt work at all , the cupboard underneath had no base and I certainly wouldnt have put any of my clothing in the cupboards as it all smelt. The bathroom was equally nasty, the shower curtain was brown and didnt appear to have been replaced in years, the tap on the sink was hanging off, no plug in the bath if you could face using it. My one positive comment was it did have hot water for a shower, I needed this as the room was so incredibly cold it was the only thing that could warm me up. There was no way of controlling the air con, you couldnt even turn it off. I felt incredibly uncomfortable staying at this hotel and being a young white blonde female I felt out of place. As the lifts were not working I had to use the stairs and on each occassion there were men lurking around. Once in my room I later plucked up the courage to walk to reception to enquire about food and was told there was no onsite restaurant. I felt isolated in my room and only saw indian men and I felt worried for my safety. There were now a lot of men in reception and I was the only female there. I didnt want to venture out the hotel for food and felt it was too late to move and find an alternative, I only had to get through 1 night. Once back in my room I decided to get an early night, however the nightclub's loud music kept me awake throughout the night until approx 4am. All in all a horrid experience and I would not want to put myself through that again. This is not a hotel, I believe its a brothel.

Reviews.Title: “**AVOID AVOID**ITS A BROTHEL & ITS DISGUSTING......”
Reviews.Author: HONESTBRITUk
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Dubai when 1st arrived was told lift not working and room allocated was on 4th floor, said lift would not be working throughout the stay and was promised to be moved the next day to a lower floor. However next day was told could be moved to 7th floor instaed. When came back from 1st day out, noticed there was a lot of indian men and young women on the 1st and 2nd floor only to realise the hotel is actually being used as a brothel. Room disgusting and bath had roaches. There was stains on the bedding and burnt holes, NO A/C in room as described on internet. Left after 2nd night due to staff rudeness, noise, dirtyness and self respect of having to come in and out of a prostitute den!

Reviews.Title: “¿Hotel or Night Club?”
Reviews.Author: manuelgonz55
Reviews.Content: It's a really bad hotel... Ground floor had a night club inside. First floor had "Karaoke". Second floor had "Massage rooms". The bathroom had in it an used razor blade, from a previous guest (I guess). Wifi is not free anymore. It now costs 3$ / h. There wasn't any 24h Wifi Access Card. We will never repeat this experience.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD A/C SYSTEM SOME ROOMS SHARE A/C SWITCH”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahAlfanar
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir, A month ago while I was searching for suitable hotel in Dubai, I came cross your hotel. I decided to contact and make reservation. I checked on August 31st. when I entered the room, I found so cold. I saw the A/C switch and tried to adjust it. I was feeling so tired so I didn’t bother to contact your service staff. Also because it was late and I didn’t want to disturb anyone that time. I just covered myself and slept. Next morning September 1st I called up reception and ask to fix it. I asked why the switch is not working, and I was shocked to hear the answer that there is no switch in the room and few rooms have one switch!!!!!!!!!!!!! How do you expect guests to stay in rooms where they can’t control the A/C? this is not a restaurant or café. It is a room where guest take bath, change clothes and sleep. It is the first time I see something like that. Going back to my room issue. When I ask to fix it, they did it that time. Few hours later around 11:00 am I went outside and came back around 3:00 pm. When I entered the room, again it was so cold. When I took of my shoes I couldn’t touch the floor with my bare foots!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I called up t he reception again and send someone to fix it. Room become ok for couple of hours. Then again it back to be like a freezer. That time I was really upset and fade up. I can’t call service or reception every time I want to adjust the A/C!!!!!!! and its happening all the time that the A/C is back to the freezing point. I decided to change the hotel then I did it. I checked out around 6:00 pm and told the receptionist I don’t care if you will charge me for tonight because I will never stay anymore here. I paid for two nights and left. I will never be your guest again and defiantly I will never recommend it to anyone I know. Instead I will recommend the second hotel I stayed in which was very nice (Landmark Hotel). Abdullah Alfanar

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: angelinajohnson44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Falcon, hoping that like all other places in Dubai, it would be safe and clean. The rooms were pretty tiny, and the restroom had these disgusting tiny insects in it. The lamp in the room was broken, and they never bothered fixing it, despite are repeated requests. There was some "Pakistani Night Club" in the hotel, which was a glorified pick up joint. The general crowd was sketchy looking beefy men, who were constantly leering at us, and lurking around the hotel. We once saw one of the dance girls, who looked barely above 16! We were so scandalized! The entrance has a billboard which displays all polaroid pictures of the "Pakistani Entertainers". This is put up post 9 in the night. It's so creepy. Sleep was nearly impossible, as we could here loud Bollywood songs pumping through the walls till 3:30 am! I would never advice anyone to stay here. Especially a no-no for women. The crowd is shady, the hotel staff sleazy, and the general ambience murky. Stay away if you want to have a decent trip. p.s.: I would advice most people to keep away from the Deira part of the city. It is mostly old Dubai. Look at living near Jumeirah Beach Residence or something safer and more cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel, rooms are so small”
Reviews.Author: Ali42Pakistan
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel in month of Jan 2010, the rooms are very small and some smell in the room. only 03 to 04 TV channel, very small lobby. ONLY ONE GOOD THING Of this hotel is Free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amirhossein79
Reviews.Content: It is a 3 star hotel... but it is always noisy on the Mezanin floor. overall quality is low except the rooms which is okay. well there are loads of other good hotels in Dubai in nice places like Jumeirah and Dubai Marina... in my opinion choose another hotel as it is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Now Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Dubaimood
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of Royal Falcon Hotel, before this hotel was leased out to some other person from 10th. October 2004 to 9th. October, 2009 for 5 years. I have recently taken back my property from the previous tenant. When I handed over this property in 2004 it was in a very good condition & we were operating the hotel very professionally. Now again the hotel cleanliness & other services are much better than before. And soon every thing will be al right. I am really sorry for the suffrings of some of the travellors here at Royal Falcon Hotel. I would like to invite them to visit Royal Falcon Hotel again & give us their feed back to improve further. Thanks Owner Royal Falcon Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not The best I have to say”
Reviews.Author: travelmeiraq
Reviews.Content: I had been through Dubai many times and stayed in some basic costs hotels which I would call around $120 per night. I had just changed companies and was put up in this hotel and arrived around midnight from the flight. They were very polite I have to say and no issues and managed to be given an upgraded room on the 5th floor which you could still here the thumping night club below. I was happy with the additional sound of the AC as it partially blocked the sound of the club I decided to go for a good showert to find that hot water was a specialty let along pressure for the shower so took the drip bath instead. I ended up getting to sleep to get up early and head back to the airport to go into Iraq. I thought I would grab some breakfast as it was free apparently but to be told sorry does not open till 7.00am but they did let me sit in the foyeur and fetch me a couple of boiled eggs and some tang which was the substitute for orange juice apparently. I found I had a container to live in in Iraq that was better then the hotel Im now heading back out and need a hotel for 2 days for a good price and just found the falcon and thought yeah I had better write a review. It maybe good for some but not interested in doing it again myself cheers

Reviews.Title: “never ever i wouldnot even recomend this hotel to my enemy”
Reviews.Author: alishahraki
Reviews.Content: the picture you see in their advert is old one naw very big biulding site next to it which will start working night because of hot wether so no sleep night time can you belive for 3 days me and my poor family staid there we could not find any disent resturant to eat we even tryed to ask the reception for help in that hot wether they gave me wrong address for resturant and me and my disable child got realy sike of being walking around to find some thing to eat and then because of heat we court taxi to cross the road he toke us around and ripd us up we asked them if they know any resturant which will deliver there they say no we phone and resturant in their yellow page and asked them for delivery they would not do it so we had to pay very expensive price for very rubish fishfingers and chips for 3 day we had to cope with their rubish fishfingers and chips which for 6 month i didnot want to eat chips or fish that made me even hate dubai so in my opinian donot even go near by this hotel if you donot want to die

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the worst hotels in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBSouthampton_UK
Reviews.Content: I was asked unexpectedly to visit Dubai on business - at such short notice it was impossible to get a reasonable hotel. Where do I start? Well the building is right next door to the new Dubai metro system - with 24 hr building work it makes the noise level very high. The location makes it diffcult to get transport - and that's without the awful congestion around Deira. The hotel smells awful and the service on the front desk was at best indifferent. The room was clean although the shower did not have automatic hot water. (a switch on the wall outside) The towels were thin and grey and I had to ask 5 times for one!! I skipped breakfast after walking past the kitchen - I just would not eat anything. It just doesn't match up to western standard!! And to add insult - it has night club which was pumping out music until 2.00am. Thankfully I didn't need to spend much time there. I won't be staying again!! How Dubai Tourism can rate it as 3 star..at best one star and only because it had an ensuite bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Dubai?”
Reviews.Author: travellingbriefcase
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, I only had a 7 hour stopover to endure here. On arrival (at 21:30) my room was not ready, despite the fact my employer had booked and paid in advance. 15 mins later and I was taken to a room barely large enough for the 2 single beds it contained (booking was for a double room not twin). There was no complimentary drinking water and the mini-bar/fridge was empty and switched off. Air-conditioning controls had been disabled using what looks to have been a hammer, so the room was unbearably hot. This was offset by the fact there was no hot running water, so I could cool down using the incredibly low pressure shower. Bed linen was thread-bare. Only one English speaking TV Channel (BBC World) Staff, whilst friendly and approachable, were inept. Took them an hour to provide me with a working username and password for the wi/fi system. (which was useless anyway). All in all, I have stayed in better B&B accommodation in British seaside resorts for a third of the price. Avoid this dump at all costs. Apologies to my administrative assistant for the ear-bashing she received for booking this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Truly horrible”
Reviews.Author: J-CDup
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels in Dubai. Apart from a few friendly (but ineffective) staff, just about everything was wrong. No hot water at all in the hotel during the whole 3 days I stayed there, and no explanation or apology from the staff. Even worse, the individual aircon controls in rooms are not actually connected. The aircon is controlled centrally and is kept much too cold - I guess around 16-18 degees centigrade. Don't stay there!

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Falcon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Salahuddin Rd, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
